member.name: P:SudokuStudio.App.WindowManager
member.summary: Indicates the window manager.

remarks.para: This property is used by checking running window, which is helpful on multiple-window interaction.

para.i: This property can also be used by and cases, for getting the running window that the current control lies in. However, due to not implementing of WinUI 3 official APIs, when call and will directly cause an exception thrown, which scenario is nearly same as this issue mentioned as an issue in GitHub. In addition, I found this discussion to describe about handling, which wants to solve this problem.
However, today's API still throw exception, which means we can still not use and at present.

member.seealso: Improved APIs for Picker/Dialog classes that implement

summary.para: Defines an attribute that is used for an auto-notifying field, to define the customized callback method name.

In addition, if you name the callback method "PropertyNameSetterAfter" (where "PropertyName" will be replaced with your property), it will be automatically related to source generator, equivalent to expression ((PropertyNameSetterAfter)).
Initializes a instance.

If the callback method ends with string SetterAfter and starts with the property name, the method will be automatically referenced to the source generation if the method parameters are compatible with the basic rule of source generation condition.

summary.para: Indicates the new value to be replaced.

The type of the value is because the internal type will be varied from different value of property . The target type is:
Value of property Target type of this property
An value indicating the candidate eliminated.
An value indicating the candidates eliminated, by >> 9 to get the target cell, and & 511 to get digits eliminated.
An value indicating the candidate set.
An value indicating the cell to be set empty.
A value indicating the newer grid to be replaced with the original one.
A value indicating the newer grid to be replaced with the original one.
A value indicating the newer grid to be replaced with the original one.
You can use pattern matching to check the internal type such as NewValue is int targetValue, or just use type casting: (int)NewValue if you know what the behavior is currently.

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Please input a series of digits, indicating the dash style of a chain link. Digits are the length of all split sub-lines. For example, "3,2" means a dotted line with contain several periods of two sub-lines, with lengths 3 and 2. The puzzle will generate some puzzles and display them one by one, you should input the result inside the sudoku pane. No matter whether your answer is correct, program will go to the next puzzle. remarks.para: Introduced in Windows 10, version 1709.
Source: DispatcherQueueOptions structure (dispatcherqueue.h).

member.name: F:SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.DispatcherQueueOptions.dwSize
member.summary: Size of this DispatcherQueueOptions structure.

member.name: F:SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.DispatcherQueueOptions.threadType
member.summary: Thread affinity for the created DispatcherQueueController.

member.name: F:SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.DispatcherQueueOptions.apartmentType
member.summary: Specifies whether to initialize COM apartment on the new thread as an application single-threaded apartment (ASTA) or single-threaded apartment (STA). This field is only relevant if is DQTYPE_THREAD_DEDICATED. Use DQTAT_COM_NONE when is DQTYPE_THREAD_CURRENT.

member.name: T:SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.MonitorDpiType
member.summary: Identifies the dots per inch (dpi) setting for a monitor.

remarks.para: All of these settings are affected by the PROCESS_DPI_AWARENESS of your application.
Source: MONITOR_DPI_TYPE enumeration (shellscalingapi.h).

summary.para: Value: 0
The effective DPI. This value should be used when determining the correct scale factor for scaling UI elements. This incorporates the scale factor set by the user for this specific display.
Value: 1
The angular DPI. This DPI ensures rendering at a compliant angular resolution on the screen. This does not include the scale factor set by the user for this specific display.
Value: 2

The raw DPI. This value is the linear DPI of the screen as measured on the screen itself. Use this value when you want to read the pixel density and not the recommended scaling setting. This does not include the scale factor set by the user for this specific display and is not guaranteed to be a supported DPI value.

member.summary: The default DPI setting for a monitor is .
